title: The stucture of our maven project

paragraphs.text:
The generic pom.xml that we use, this is a minimal generic pom.
The dependencies:.
  • Version 2.8.1 of Apache Kafka
  • Used by Kafka : Jackson for handling Json
  • Used by Kafka : slf4j impementation of log4j
  • Undertow is needed for interactive communication (rest/websockets)
  • Jupiter we add for unit testing
  • For our course: serializers for educational purposes
  • For our course: the course materials
One point of concern is the many messages coming from apache kafka in the log. We propose the following log4j.xml file, to be placed under ./src/main/resources/log4j.xml

This log4j configuration handles messages coming from apache kafka different then the messages coming from our examples.
The Kafka messages are stored in /log/...
Extra for this course: unzip these 2 zips in a dir of your choice, and do mvn install for both to add them to your local mvn repository
Now your project structure should be ready for the course, we will test the basics by making an app.java with a simple main, and simulate messages coming from Kafka

Now do 'mvn clean install' and inspect the target directory.
You will see there is a fat jar 'les02-jar-with-dependencies.jar'.
Apache Kafka applications are standalone applications and can be run by calling the class with a main method

The fat jar is important in production.
In development we can do without.
